III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
Description administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
1

program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A touched Youth B on his "private parts" on an outing at
McDonalds.
Investigation Interviews:
I spoke to Complainant 1 on 1/21/25. Complainant 1 reported
Youth B left the facility on 1/17/25 and is in independent living
now. Complainant 1 reported she did not witness the allegations
but heard them through a youth at the program. Complainant 1
reported she did not suspect abuse or neglect or think that it
happened.
Youth A was interviewed on 1/22/25 face to face at the facility.
Youth A reported on 1/17/25, she went to McDonalds with Staff 1,
Staff 2, and Youth B to celebrate his successful release from the
program. Youth A reported they took an agency van to
McDonalds, and she sat in the back with Staff 1 and Youth B sat
in the front with Staff 2. At McDonalds Youth A and Youth B sat
across from each other in a booth and the staff were behind them
in a booth. Youth A reported she was turned around in the booth
talking to Staff 1 at times and sometimes talking to Youth B. Youth
A reported neither staff ever left them alone together. Youth A
reported she did not touch Youth B in the van or in McDonalds on
his private parts or anywhere else.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on 1/27/25. Youth B
reported he went to McDonalds on 1/17/25 with Staff 1, Staff 2
and Youth A. Youth B reported he sat in the front of the van with
Staff 2 and Youth A sat in the back of the van with Youth A. Youth
B reported he sat at a booth across from Youth A and the staff
were at the booth behind them. Youth B reported Youth A did not
touch his privates or attempt to touch his privates or any other part
of his body. Youth B reported staff were engaged in conversation
with them while at McDonalds and the staff never left their
presence.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed via telephone on 1/27/25
separately. Both reported Youth A sat in the back of the van with
Staff 1 and Youth B sat in the front of the van with Staff 2. Staff 2
was driving the van. Both reported Youth A and Youth B were in
the booth together at McDonalds, sitting on opposite sides. Both
reported they were in the booth behind them and all of them were
2

talking together. Both staff reported they were with the youth the
entire time and did not see either youth touch each other in the
private area.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Both staff and youth
reported the staff were present and supervising the entire time
they were off site at McDonalds.
Conclusion Violation not established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
